meanings.definition: A social organization for male college students.
meanings.sent1: My brother joined a frat in college.
meanings.sent2: The frat hosted a charity event on campus.
meanings.sent3: The frat brothers always wore matching shirts to their meetings.
meanings.sent4: Being part of the frat felt like being part of a big family.
meanings.sent5: The frat house was always filled with laughter and camaraderie.

meanings.sent1: He proudly displayed his frat letters on his jacket.
meanings.sent2: The alumni came back to visit their old frat house.
meanings.sent3: The frat symbol was painted on the wall in bold colors.
meanings.sent4: Joining the frat meant becoming part of a long-standing tradition.
meanings.sent5: The frat pin was a symbol of belonging and pride.

meanings.definition: A brotherhood or group of people sharing common interests or goals.
meanings.sent1: Their hiking group felt like a frat with all the shared experiences.
meanings.sent2: The team at work formed a tight-knit frat that supported each other.
meanings.sent3: The book club was like a frat for book lovers.
meanings.sent4: Their neighborhood watch group was a frat dedicated to keeping the community safe.
meanings.sent5: The volunteer organization became a frat of like-minded individuals.
